html:
It's been a year of remote work at Khan Academy! I'm learning a lot as a prompt engineer on the Teacher Experience team. Since last fall, I've been on a personal road show visiting friends in Boston, Baltimore, Portland, Honolulu, Frankfurt, Chicago, and New York City. Still trying to figure out where I want to live.

I'm listening to the Linda Lindas (pictured) and the new albums from Lucy Dacus and Japanese Breakfast.

Oh! Les Beaux Jours, Maro Michalakakos (2012). Just sending this postcard home because I liked this one, and I liked spending the month in New York City. Thinking about that HAIM song about Los Angeles though.

- Jenny

I wrapped up my time at the daplab, and I'm now at Khan Academy, building AI tools for teachers!

I'm listening to lots of Planet Giza, Vampire Weekend, Discovery, and Beyonce. Went to Joshua Tree (pictured) in February and saw the grunion run along Cabrillo Beach (not pictured) in April for the first time. Both were breathtaking.

Published work with friends and collaborators on (1) identity authorship in CS classrooms at the annual meeting of the International Society for Learning Sciences and on (2) LLMs for creative work and exploratory programming at the ACM Symposium on User Interface Software and Technology (UIST).

The UIST project was the first research project that I initiated, from start to finish, and it was also the first Replit collaboration with an academic institution. Proud that these two projects from my master's program days finally got to see the light!

I'm still building and codesigning tools for learning at the Design & Partnership Lab at UC Irvine. :)

I'm trying to finish the wedding podcast I promised to make for one of my best friends who just got married! Procrastinating on that by listening to Wind of Change from Crooked Media. Saw the bioluminescent waves (pictured) in Newport Beach.

I had the privilege of subbing for my mentor as a qualitative researcher at the annual meeting of the Association for the Sciences of Limnology and Oceanography. I interviewed a cohort of graduate student researchers, and learned about their experiences with international research exchange!

Had an ensaimada for the first time and inhaled it. Got to visit Copenhagen to visit a friend on the layover there too! Listening to Wet Leg.

In personal news, I spent some time traveling with friends by train (Amtrak Crescent), ferry (Vancouver <> Victoria), plane, and car. Grateful for time with friends at all sorts of pivotal moments in their lives.

Listening to Maggie Rogers and 100 gecs.

Hey! I've been building data visualization tools for math teachers as part of the Design & Partnership Lab at UC Irvine (leaning into remote work; just moved here for the year. go ravens.).

I'm exploring the corners of Charm City by bike while listening to WYPR and IGOR.

Hey! I just graduated from my master's last month and have been teaching CS106B at Stanford with one of my best friends Kylie this summer. Nothing like in person lectures!

I'm listening to Un Verano Sin Ti and the soundtrack to Severance while eating lots of late night L & L spam musubi.
